titleStmt.title: To the worshipful our good benefactor In all lamentable manner, most humbly beseecheth your good worship, wee the miserable multitude of very poore distressed prisoners, in the hole of Woodstreet Counter, in nomber fifite poore men, or thereabouts, ying vpon the bare boordes, still languishing in great neede, ...

notesStmt.note: An appeal for alms for Easter.
Imperfect; mutilated with some loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

With: A proper new balad in praise of my ladie Marques / W. Elderton. Imprinted at London : In Fletestreat ... by Thomas Colwell, [1569] -- A new ballad against vnthrifts. Imprinted at London : At the long Shop ... by Iohn Alde, [1562].
